content.description: Begin on the smooth face left of the arete climb. Pull through pockets and crimps on a longer climb.

Smoking Winston Cigarettes is probably the best climb of the three on this buttress. It starts on the right side of the arete and climbs past brown/red Metolius hangers frequently using the arete with the left hand and face holds with the right. Many holds are shared with Smiling at the Majorettes, but this route climbs quite differently, and better.
content.protection: 7x bolts to a shared chain anchor above the arete.
content.location: Begin just right of the sharp arete.

content.description: Climb up the vertical block using the right arete as much as you want. There is some loose rock on this climb as well as being a little dirty towards the end. More traffic and some brushing would do be great.
content.protection: 6 bolts to shared chain anchor above arete.

content.description: This is the tallest route at the The Overlook and features enjoyable 5.11 climbing to a roof crux at the last bolt. Begin with 3x bolts of loose rock. At the 4th bolt the rock improves and good climbing leads to the roof capping the top of the buttress. Pull this with difficulty to a pair of lower-offs.
content.location: This climb is the right hand of two that beginÂ on a narrow buttress at the lowest point of The Overlook. Scramble down past Howard Hughes, continue down the loose slope next to the wall to Smiling at the Majorettes (obvious sharp arete), and continue a short distance further around a corner to this route.
